title: Srimad Bhagavatam | HG Chanchalapathi Dasa | SB 3.15.37 | 19-02-2016
speaker: HG Chanchalapathi Dasa

segments.text: In Bhagavad Gita, the Lord declares that his devotees cannot be vanquished at any time.
The Lord could understand that the quarrel between the doorman and the sages was taking a different turn.
And therefore, he instantly came out of his place and went to the spot to stop further aggravation so that his devotees, the doorman, might not be vanquished for good.
We are reading in the Srimad Bhagavatam, in this part, about the two doormen stopping the sages.
And the sages becoming angry and we just saw in the previous verses, they cursed that they should go down to the earthly planet.
And we also saw that the two doormen very graciously accepted the curse that was delivered to them.
And in today's verse, we are seeing,
how the Lord responded when he was aware that this was going on at the seventh gate of his Vaikuntha.
evam tadhaiva bhagavan aravindha nabhah svanam vibhudhya sadatikramam arya hridyah tasmin yayo
